channel.title: Buzzing on The Wall Street Journal
channel.description: 用中文浏览华尔街日报热门报道

item.title: Elon Musk appears to have deleted some tweets taking aim at Twitter amid his decision not to join the social-media company’s board. Over the weekend, the Tesla CEO tweeted criticisms, suggestions and apparent jokes about Twitter. https://t.co/rGwTW4cbNx

Far-right French presidential candidate Marine Le Pen wants to remove French forces from NATO's command, claw back powers from the EU and limit the place of immigrants in French society https://t.co/v1zEb1cZDs
Europe’s largest poultry farm, on Ukraine’s occupied Black Sea coast, has lost almost four million chickens to thirst and starvation during the country’s war with Russia https://t.co/YiogWCP6wM
Twitter’s CEO said Tesla founder Elon Musk decided he won’t join the social-media company’s board of directors #WSJWhatsNow https://t.co/4tgiJAQKun https://t.co/F59BUDSmuW
A beloved mayor and her family helped townspeople resist Russian occupation. They paid for it with their lives. https://t.co/5WhxX0QAB0
Why are there so many shows about younger, fallen CEOs? https://t.co/A9jz9jsIdp
The U.S. is watching with dismay as several allied African military leaders—including officers with extensive American schooling—overthrow civilian governments and seize power https://t.co/ZlTegOAw1d
From @WSJopinion: Gen. David H. Berger’s dramatic reform program would prepare the U.S. to better face its primary enemy: China, writes @TomRtweets https://t.co/bKvmAe6JTK
Breaking: Elon Musk reversed his decision to join Twitter's board, CEO Parag Agrawal said. The move comes after Mr. Musk tweeted criticism about the company. https://t.co/sKxkvpjv5i
Europe’s largest poultry farm, on Ukraine’s occupied Black Sea coast, has lost almost four million chickens to thirst and starvation during the country’s war with Russia https://t.co/77WbJU2Q7r
Pope Francis on Sunday called for an Easter truce in the war in Ukraine to facilitate peace talks https://t.co/L3djY936pa
President Emmanuel Macron and far-right leader Marine Le Pen led the first round of France’s presidential election, according to exit polls https://t.co/zCujkpq7i5
A beloved mayor and her family helped townspeople resist Russian occupation. They paid for it with their lives. https://t.co/CuFcuXPMrp
Breaking: Scottie Scheffler won the Masters, his first major championship. The 25-year-old American has rapidly ascended to become the world's No. 1 golfer. https://t.co/cJqklY4Wxs
Israel is fighting an undeclared war with Iran. It began as covert airstrikes and is expanding to attacks inside Iran’s borders, at sea and above Israel’s skies. https://t.co/Pbp4GPa4YX

Hundreds of thousands of professionals, including tech workers, scientists, bankers and doctors, have left Russia since its invasion of Ukraine: “I can’t live in a country that goes to war with its neighbors.” https://t.co/y68GNDezsf
Europe’s largest poultry farm, on Ukraine’s occupied Black Sea coast, has lost almost four million chickens to thirst and starvation during the country’s war with Russia https://t.co/sVuHl6p1UN
With 25 million people in a Covid lockdown, Shanghai has reported no deaths and says currently only one case is severe https://t.co/E2DKVuMEO7
A Russian region near the Ukraine border that Russia used as a staging ground for its invasion announced that it is going on alert Monday https://t.co/x8Qf9AG75P
Unlike the first part of the Ukraine war, with its guerrilla tactics, officials expect large-scale tank and artillery battles for the eastern Donbas region https://t.co/Rg38ogQuqt

Elon Musk, Twitter’s newest board member and largest shareholder, said Twitter Blue should ban ads, lower its price and even consider accepting dogecoin as payment. He also said subscribers should get an authentication checkmark. https://t.co/rdwPmV2c3S

Russia is turning to military veterans discharged during the past decade to fill out its ranks, the U.K. Defense Ministry said, after Russian forces encountered losses in the country’s invasion of Ukraine https://t.co/hyI6iaAN7l

Economists surveyed by The Wall Street Journal this month on average put the probability of the economy being in recession sometime in the next year at 28%, up from 18% in January and just 13% a year ago https://t.co/7oo0MQRpoG

Hundreds of thousands of professionals, including tech workers, scientists, bankers and doctors, have left Russia since its invasion of Ukraine: “I can’t live in a country that goes to war with its neighbors.” https://t.co/nC3jB8rvJE

Once-loyal Democratic voters, blaming their party for the ill effects of Covid restrictions on their children, are defecting to Republican candidates—a threat Democrats face in November’s midterm elections. https://t.co/o4gjAPopxr
Ukraine’s foreign minister said Sunday his country had won the battle in Kyiv and was now preparing for the next one: “Now, another battle is coming, the battle for Donbas." https://t.co/bnvQbnHl8F

Ukraine’s truckers are facing roadblocks, fuel shortages and wartime peril to keep goods moving: “I only think about how I can get the cargo as fast as possible to the people in need.” https://t.co/6aKYefcZ5N
France is voting in an election in which far-right leader Marine Le Pen has suddenly closed in on Macron https://t.co/l5zbSTCfG7
Israel is fighting an undeclared war with Iran. It began as covert airstrikes and is expanding to attacks inside Iran’s borders, at sea and above Israel’s skies. https://t.co/0IXVXlBdDO
For Belarusian and Russian volunteers, the path to freedom at home runs through defeating the Russian army in Ukraine https://t.co/QgFtd6LAYc
Hundreds of thousands of professional workers have left Russia since its invasion of Ukraine: “I can’t live in a country that goes to war with its neighbors.” https://t.co/zxEBBzqvqk
A beloved mayor and her family helped townspeople resist Russian occupation. They paid for it with their lives. https://t.co/luPa2vQzzH

From @WSJopinion: The outcome in Ukraine will define a new world order, for good or ill. The U.S. can restore its leadership of the free world, or it can lead from behind while democracy continues to lose ground, writes Garry Kasparov. https://t.co/FLuRbltSYo
Europe’s largest poultry farm, on Ukraine’s occupied Black Sea coast, has lost almost four million chickens to thirst and starvation during the country’s war with Russia https://t.co/Jfmq2cXnjK
Europe is banning imports of two of Russia’s best-known specialties: caviar and vodka https://t.co/v8j7ohQgLb
Global food prices hit a new record high in March https://t.co/OgXb7V02E7
The U.S. is watching with dismay as several allied African military leaders—including officers with extensive American schooling—overthrow civilian governments and seize power https://t.co/QN9PajODli

Chinese leaders see a stronger nuclear arsenal as a way to deter the U.S. from getting directly involved in a potential conflict over Taiwan, people close to the leadership say https://t.co/YhYRowlJXJ

The BA.2 variant’s growing share of Covid-19 cases and a spate of high-profile infections is complicating how people deal with the risk. How worried should you be if you test positive? https://t.co/BnfaDAUYwP

Hasan’s three-day journey from Ukraine to Slovakia relied on the goodwill of volunteers and border guards and the wits of a small boy bearing his brother’s name and phone number scribbled on his hand https://t.co/BrnNpenli1
Pink Floyd is releasing a new song called “Hey Hey Rise Up” to support the people of Ukraine, marking the band’s first new recording in nearly three decades https://t.co/PwP70mcJcK

Watch: A WSJ analysis of videos, photos and satellite images from four weeks in March reveals how Russian forces destroyed civilian infrastructure through a series of shellings, with remnants of weapons indicating the use of cluster bombs https://t.co/xCIoZlUQAR

From @WSJopinion: Instead of striving to be a tolerant society, we are now directed to become the very opposite. This intolerant place evidently needs coercive policing by institutions wearing Mickey Mouse ears, writes @gerardtbaker. https://t.co/U6mYF7zP0R

China has accelerated an expansion of its nuclear arsenal because of a change in its assessment of the threat posed by the U.S., people with knowledge of the Chinese leadership’s thinking say https://t.co/PEnab5v5DX
Global food prices hit a new record high in March, the United Nations said Friday, as the war in Ukraine threatens food shortages in some of the world’s poorest countries https://t.co/D7Hkxqiy1T
Elon Musk has set the stage for a new fight with the SEC, this time over how he disclosed his investment in Twitter https://t.co/xFX8hKyuom
U.K. Prime Minister Boris Johnson traveled to Kyiv for talks with Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelensky, bearing offers of new military and other assistance https://t.co/DjCcs7xijW
TikTok brain is real, researchers say, and it’s affecting kids’ brain development. "We’ve made kids live in a candy store." https://t.co/VM9MsrnA68
The Russian soldiers were polite at first when they seized Bucha. Then the killings started. "They turned into beasts." https://t.co/VpUJt5cENv
From @WSJopinion: Congratulations to the new Justice, although we hope Justice Ketanji Brown Jackson finds herself more influenced by her new colleagues than vice versa https://t.co/KeQnDxAfGC
